repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
### Problem

Treesitter parsers are currently distributed as compiled shared objects which need to be compiled by the users (with the help of nvim-treesitter).

### Solution

Allow loading wasm built parsers.

Notes:
- For now this is an optional build-time feature (via `ENABLE_WASMTIME`) which will be dynamically linked.
  - Builds with `make CMAKE_EXTRA_FLAGS=-DENABLE_WASMTIME=ON`
- Treesitter requires being built with `TREE_SITTER_FEATURE_WASM` and also requires `wasmtime` at build time. So no `[uv_]dlopen` ðŸ˜¢ 
- `wasmtime` has includes that require C11 (`static_assert`).

comment_data.body:
```suggestion
  GIT_TAG release-19.0.2
```
might as well use the latest and greatest ;) (though 20.0.0 is scheduled for today or tomorrow)
Derp, this was old code. Should be removed, thanks.

comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -37,7 +37,7 @@ if [[ $os == Linux ]]; then
   fi
 elif [[ $os == Darwin ]]; then
   brew update --quiet
-  brew install ninja
+  brew install ninja wasmtime

comment_data.body: @dundargoc is this the right way to do it?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -9,7 +9,12 @@ add_compile_options(-w)
 
 add_library(tree-sitter lib/src/lib.c)
 target_include_directories(tree-sitter
-  PRIVATE lib/src lib/include)
+  PRIVATE lib/src lib/src/wasm lib/include)
+
+option(ENABLE_WASMTIME "Use treesitter with wasmtime support." OFF)

comment_data.body: This is a bit sus. Why is this needed? It should in theory work without this.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -9,7 +9,12 @@ add_compile_options(-w)
 
 add_library(tree-sitter lib/src/lib.c)
 target_include_directories(tree-sitter
-  PRIVATE lib/src lib/include)
+  PRIVATE lib/src lib/src/wasm lib/include)
+
+option(ENABLE_WASMTIME "Use treesitter with wasmtime support." OFF)

comment_data.body: Aha, I understand now. Give me a sec.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -9,7 +9,12 @@ add_compile_options(-w)
 
 add_library(tree-sitter lib/src/lib.c)
 target_include_directories(tree-sitter
-  PRIVATE lib/src lib/include)
+  PRIVATE lib/src lib/src/wasm lib/include)
+
+option(ENABLE_WASMTIME "Use treesitter with wasmtime support." OFF)

comment_data.body: TODO(dundargoc): investigate if we should nuke c99 across the board
TODO(dundargoc): hacky, should add a directory for the `.deps` directory directly, alternatively ensure the relevant files are in usr.

TODO(dundargoc): this some bullshit, wasmtime don't have the header Â´wasm.hÂ´ in their release branches. This means we can't use any of their release branches or release tags with the current setup. Unsure if using a main commit is good for now or we need to ask wasmtime why they're doing this.
TODO(dundargoc): this will always use release which isn't great. Could use a genex here to fix it. Alternatively we could fix the cmake file in wasmtime and use that instead.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,10 @@
+get_externalproject_options(wasmtime ${DEPS_IGNORE_SHA})
+ExternalProject_Add(wasmtime
+  DOWNLOAD_DIR ${DEPS_DOWNLOAD_DIR}/wasmtime
+  CONFIGURE_COMMAND ""
+  BUILD_COMMAND cargo build --release -p wasmtime-c-api

comment_regular_data.body: Is this something we want to add to `BUILD.md` (yet)?
Maybe, do you have anything to propose? I'm not sure what to add.
Not yet; I agree the wording needs to be careful. We want to phase this in slowly.

title: feat(treesitter): add support for wasm parsers
